Package game.actors.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.actors.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Capable, Printable, Resettable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GiantCrab, GiantCrayfish, GiantDog, HeavySkeletalSwordsman, LoneWolf, PileOfBones, SkeletalBandit
public abstract class Enemy extends Actor implements Resettable
An abstract that represents enemies in the game
Author:
AppliedSession03Group03

      displayChar - the character that will represent the Enemy in the display
      hitPoints - the Enemy's starting hit points
      enemyType - the type of the Enemy

      public static boolean isSameEnemy​(Actor actor1, Actor actor2)
      Checks if the 2 Actor are the same type of Enemy
      Parameters:

      actor2 - An actor
      Returns:

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions​(Actor otherActor, String direction, GameMap map)
      The Enemy can be attacked by any actor that has the HOSTILE_TO_ENEMY capability and if the Enemy is conscious
      Overrides:
      allowableActions in class Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      A list of actions that are allowed to be performed by otherActor

      Removes spawnable Enemy from the game when reset
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Resettable
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor that triggered an entire game reset
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn​(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      Determines the action to execute at current turn
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written

      the action to execute
